name: Pop-Free CB 9 Quiz | Common Bond 10 Questions | 10 Questions

questions.text: "Cry me a river" is an example of a...
questions.explanation:
cliche.

	A cliche is any trite phrase repeated so often that it loses its impact.

questions.text: In the sentence "He espied the king's men, and the king's gold," what does "espied" mean?
questions.explanation:
viewed.

	"Espy" is a synonym of "view". It is etymologically related to "spy", as in "I spy something that is green", but it does not have the same connotation as spying upon someone.

questions.text: If you had an adz, you would probably use it to...
questions.explanation:
cut wood.

	An adz is a type of axe with a curved blade. It was used to trim and shape logs.

questions.text: If a Scotsman asked you if you "kenned" something, he wants to know if you _____ it.
questions.explanation:
understood.

	"To ken" can also mean "to know", such as in the old foxhunting song "John Peel", which began:"Do ye ken John Peel with his coat so gay?"

questions.text: The space shuttle is called a "shuttle" because it can...
questions.explanation:
move back and forth.

	The word "shuttle" came from the part of a loom that was moved back and forth during weaving. The word was then applied to other objects that move back and forth; that is able to return.

	A rongeur is an instrument used in surgery for cutting away small bits of rough bone.

questions.text: If Martin Luther King decided that he needed another way to say "I have a dream" what could he say instead? "I..."
questions.explanation:
envision.

	To envision is to imagine or to foresee.

questions.text: President Richard Nixon was the first US President who _________ China while in office.
questions.explanation:
visited.

	Nixon visited China in February, 1972.

questions.text: If a mongoose acted in accordance to what Rudyard Kipling proposed  in "Rikki Tikki Tavi," at the end of the day he would have gone and...
questions.explanation:
found out.

	The mongoose is a very curious animal, always into everything. Kipling claimed the mongoose motto is "Go and find out".

questions.text: All of these words have something in common - they are synonyms for one word. What is it?
questions.explanation:
saw.

	Q. 1- "Saw" is another word for "cliche", such and in the phrase "An old saw". Q. 2- "Saw" also means "viewed", as in "I saw a big tree".Q. 3- "To saw" is to cut wood with a saw.  Q. 4- "Saw" can mean "understood", as is "I saw what you were talking about".Q. 5- "Saw" can mean "move back and forth", such as "She sawed her arms in the air".Q. 6- A "saw" is an instrument for cutting.Q. 7- "Saw" can mean "envisioned", as in "He saw a wonderful future for his students".Q. 8- "Saw" can mean "visited", as in, "I saw my boyfriend last night".Q. 9- "Saw" can mean "found out", as in "He saw that the answer was '42'."
